channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management

item.title: CVE-2018-1686|2024-09-16T16:19:07.337Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 through 7.6.3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 145505.

item.title: CVE-2020-4521|2024-09-16T16:28:11.807Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unsafe deserialization in Java. By sending specially-crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 182396.

item.title: CVE-2017-1558|2024-09-16T16:43:14.217Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.5 and 7.6 could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL displayed to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 131548.
